memberdef.name: ftdi_usb_find_all

detaileddescription.para: Finds all ftdi devices with given VID:PID on the usb bus. Creates a new ftdi_device_list which needs to be deallocated by ftdi_list_free() after use. With VID:PID 0:0, search for the default devices (0x403:0x6001, 0x403:0x6010, 0x403:0x6011, 0x403:0x6014, 0x403:0x6015)

parameterdescription.para: Pointer where to store list of found devices

memberdef.name: ftdi_usb_open_desc_index

detaileddescription.para: Opens the index-th device with a given, vendor id, product id, description and serial.

parameterdescription.para: Description to search for. Use NULL if not needed.
Serial to search for. Use NULL if not needed.
Number of matching device to open if there are more than one, starts with 0.

detaileddescription.para: Opens the ftdi-device described by a description-string. Intended to be used for parsing a device-description given as commandline argument.

parameterdescription.para:
NULL-terminated description-string, using this format:
d:<devicenode> path of bus and device-node (e.g. "003/001") within usb device tree (usually at /proc/bus/usb/)
i:<vendor>:<product> first device with given vendor and product id, ids can be decimal, octal (preceded by "0") or hex (preceded by "0x")
i:<vendor>:<product>:<index> as above with index being the number of the device (starting with 0) if there are more than one
s:<vendor>:<product>:<serial> first device with given vendor id, product id and serial string

simplesect.para: The description format may be extended in later versions.

detaileddescription.para: Resets the ftdi device.
Clears the read buffer on the chip and the internal read buffer.
Clears the write buffer on the chip.
Clears the buffers on the chip and the internal read buffer.
Closes the ftdi device. Call ftdi_deinit() if you're cleaning up.

detaileddescription.para: Writes data in chunks (see ftdi_write_data_set_chunksize()) to the chip
Writes data to the chip. Does not wait for completion of the transfer nor does it make sure that the transfer was successful.
Use libusb 1.0 asynchronous API.

parameterdescription.para: Some error happens when submit transfer

detaileddescription.para: Reads data from the chip. Does not wait for completion of the transfer nor does it make sure that the transfer was successful.
Use libusb 1.0 asynchronous API.

parameterdescription.para: Some error happens when submit transfer

detaileddescription.para: Wait for completion of the transfer.
Use libusb 1.0 asynchronous API.

inbodydescription.para: tc->transfer could be NULL if "(size <= ftdi->readbuffer_remaining)" at ftdi_read_data_submit(). Therefore, we need to check it here.

detaileddescription.para: Configure write buffer chunk size. Default is 4096.
Get write buffer chunk size.

parameterdescription.para: Pointer to store chunk size in

detaileddescription.para: Reads data in chunks (see ftdi_read_data_set_chunksize()) from the chip.
Automatically strips the two modem status bytes transfered during every read.
Configure read buffer chunk size. Default is 4096.
Automatically reallocates the buffer.
Get read buffer chunk size.

parameterdescription.para: Pointer to store chunk size in

detaileddescription.para: Enable/disable bitbang modes.

parameterdescription.para: Bitmask to configure lines. HIGH/ON value configures a line as output.
Bitbang mode: use the values defined in ftdi_mpsse_mode

detaileddescription.para: Disable bitbang mode.
Directly read pin state, circumventing the read buffer. Useful for bitbang mode.
Set latency timer
The FTDI chip keeps data in the internal buffer for a specific amount of time if the buffer is not full yet to decrease load on the usb bus.
Get latency timer

parameterdescription.para: Pointer to store latency value in

detaileddescription.para: Poll modem status information

This function allows the retrieve the two status bytes of the device. The device sends these bytes also as a header for each read access where they are discarded by ftdi_read_data(). The chip generates the two stripped status bytes in the absence of data every 40 ms.

Layout of the first byte:
B0..B3 - must be 0
B4 Clear to send (CTS) 0 = inactive 1 = active
B5 Data set ready (DTS) 0 = inactive 1 = active
B6 Ring indicator (RI) 0 = inactive 1 = active
B7 Receive line signal detect (RLSD) 0 = inactive 1 = active

Layout of the second byte:
B0 Data ready (DR)
B1 Overrun error (OE)
B2 Parity error (PE)
B3 Framing error (FE)
B4 Break interrupt (BI)
B5 Transmitter holding register (THRE)
B6 Transmitter empty (TEMT)
B7 Error in RCVR FIFO

parameterdescription.para: Pointer to store status information in. Must be two bytes.

detaileddescription.para: Set flowcontrol for ftdi chip
